title: Application Takes >5 Seconds to Start
content:
## Symptom

Application takes more than 5 seconds to launch and display the main window.

**Performance target:** <2 seconds startup time

## Diagnosis

Measure actual startup time:
1. Close application completely
2. Use stopwatch or timer
3. Double-click application icon
4. Stop timer when main window appears
5. Compare to 2-second target

## Common Causes

**Network connection delay:**
- App tries to connect to all projectors on startup
- Slow DNS resolution
- Network timeout waiting for unreachable projectors
- VPN overhead

**Antivirus scanning:**
- Antivirus scans executable on every launch
- Real-time protection slows file loading
- Especially common with older antivirus software

**Database issues (SQLite mode):**
- Database file fragmentation
- Large database (thousands of history entries)
- Database on slow disk (network drive, external USB)

**System resource constraints:**
- Low available RAM (<4GB free)
- High CPU usage from other applications
- Disk thrashing (100% disk usage)

## Solutions

**Quick fixes:**

1. **Disable network check on startup:**
   - Settings > Connection > Uncheck "Connect to projectors on startup"
   - App starts instantly
   - Manual connection when needed
   - Recommended for laptop users

2. **Exclude from antivirus scanning:**
   - Contact IT administrator
   - Add `ProjectorControl.exe` to antivirus exclusion list
   - Significantly improves startup time
   - Safe if application from trusted source

3. **Use wired network:**
   - Wi-Fi DNS lookups slower than Ethernet
   - Reduces connection timeout delays
   - More reliable generally

**Advanced fixes:**

1. **Compact database (if available):**
   - Settings > Advanced > Maintenance > Compact Database
   - Rebuilds database file
   - Removes fragmentation
   - Run monthly for best performance

2. **Clear old history:**
   - Settings > Diagnostics > Clear History Cache
   - Removes thousands of old entries
   - Reduces database size
   - Faster queries

3. **Move database to faster disk:**
   - Only for Standalone (SQLite) mode
   - Ensure database on local SSD, not network drive
   - Database location: `%APPDATA%\ProjectorControl\`

4. **Check system resources:**
   - Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc)
   - Check CPU, Memory, Disk usage
   - Close unnecessary applications
   - Restart computer if resources maxed out

## Monitoring Startup Performance

**Check application logs:**
1. Settings > Advanced > Open Log Folder
2. Open most recent log file
3. Look for startup timing entries
4. Identifies which component is slow

**Typical log entries:**
```
[INFO] Application starting...
[INFO] Database loaded in 0.15s
[INFO] UI initialized in 0.32s
[INFO] Connecting to projectors... (this may be slow)
[INFO] Application ready in 1.85s
```

If "Connecting to projectors" takes >2 seconds â†’ Disable startup connection

## Expected Startup Times

**Ideal scenario:**
- Modern computer (SSD, 8GB+ RAM)
- No network check on startup
- Small database (<1000 history entries)
- **Result: 0.5-1.5 seconds**

**Typical scenario:**
- Standard computer
- Network check enabled (1 projector)
- Normal database size
- **Result: 2-3 seconds**

**Problem scenario:**
- Network check with slow/unreachable projectors
- Antivirus scanning every launch
- Large/fragmented database
- **Result: 5-10+ seconds**

## When to Contact IT

- Startup time >10 seconds after applying fixes
- Antivirus exclusion needs approval
- Database compaction not available
- Network infrastructure issues suspected

> **Tip:** For fastest startup, disable "Connect to projectors on startup" in Settings > Connection. The app will start instantly and connect when you click a button.
